page.title: 17FARM SURVEY (continued).
page.content: {Sheep and cattle}form the principal species of livestock.{Sheep}are bred mainly for mutton and wool. Types include:-Polled Dorsets,Dorset Horns, Suffolk,Cluns,Border Leicesters,Mules, Devon and Cornwall Longwools. The average flock of 300 is served by 3 rams. The majority of{cattle}are bred for beef,74 being the average for a herd. Dairy cattle average 53 per herd and produce an average of 230,500 litres of milk each year.One in three farms keeps a bull.Chief cattle cross breeds are:-Hereford/Friesian,Hereford/Devon, Charolais/Friesian,Devon/Friesian, Friesian/Limousin,Angus/Friesian and Charolais. Pure breeds include:-Devon, Friesian,Jersey,Hereford,Guernsey and Limousin.
